title: IQR of a Set of Observations
question_text:
What is the interquartile range of this set of observations?
$$\{ 5, 9, 13, 14, 18, 24, 24, 29, 30, 31, 37, 39, 48, 55, 62 \}$$
solution:
The interquartile range (IQR) is found by subtracting the $Q1$ from the $Q3$.

The easiest way to find the $Q1$ and $Q3$ is to find the median first because it sits between $Q1$ and $Q3$, dividing the numbers equally. In this case, the median is $29$: There are seven numbers on both sides of $29$.

$$\{ 5, 9, 13, \mathbf{14}, 18, 24, 24, \color{red}{29}, 30, 31, 37, \mathbf{39}, 48, 55, 62 \}$$

Thus, $14$ is the $Q1$: There are three numbers on each side of $14$ within the first seven numbers of the set. Similarly, $39$ is the $Q3$ number because it evenly divides the second half of the set.

$39-14 = 25$, which is the IQR.

Thus, the correct answer is Choice 'A'.
